description.narrative: 1. Increase Georgia''s RE output, serving both the local market and Turkey. The project will provide 61 GWh power to Georgia for the first 10 years of operations while the 372 GWh will be exported to Turkey. 2. Reduced GHG emissions of 222,379 tons p.a for 45 years of operations 3. Influence Georgia''s ability to attract foreign investments in the hydro sector and help position Georgia as a emerging market destination for hydro investments 4. Contribute to private sector investments in Georgia and attract investors and support South- South investment

The Project involves the construction and operation of the 184 MW Shuakhevi hydropower project (the Project), consisting of 2 HPP schemes: the 178 MW Shuakhevi HPP and the 6 MW Skhalta HPP by Adjaristsqali Georgia Limited (AGL). It is part of the Adjaristsqali cascade of 4 run-of-river HPPs with a total installed capacity of ~400 MW: 178 MW Shuakhevi HPP, 6 MW Skhalta HPP, 150 MW Koromkheti HPP and 65 MW Khertvisi HPP. The Project will export to Turkey through the 400 kv Akhalskhe-Borcka transmission line (the AB line) and sell domestically in Georgia for the 3 winter months (for the first 10 years of operations). Adjaristsqali Georgia LLC was founded by Clean Energy Invest in 2011. The company is a Georgian special purpose company set up to develop the Adjaristsqali Cascade Project. Today, the owners are; Clean Energy Invest of Norway, Tata Power of India and IFC, via a Dutch holding company called Adjaristsqali Netherlands BV. AGL is assisted in its operation by a very competent team of professionals. The Project has an estimated net generation output of 451 GWh on average per year (as per IFC engineer), corresponding to 4.8% of total annual generation in Georgia and is expected to be operational by July 2016.

mailing-address.narrative: Adjaristsqali Georgia LLC, 6 Irakli Abashidze street, Batumi 6010, Georgia

name.narrative: Greenfield project located site is rural and is easily accessible by road from the main city of Batumi one hour away. The Adjaristsqali Hydro Project will be located on the Adjaristsqali River and its tributaries in the Autonomous Republic of Adjara, in South Western Georgia, close to the Turkish border. The villages closest to the project are Keda, Shuakhevi and Khulo. Coordinates for Powerhouses Latitude Longitude Skhalta 41.573835 42.374760 Shuakhevi 41.637733 42.153551
